description: Global oil glut and OPEC decision not to cut output lead to sharp Brent price decline.
OPEC agrees to first production cut since 2008, targeting 1.2 million barrels per day reduction.

event_name: US withdraws from Iran nuclear deal
description: United States announces withdrawal from JCPOA and reimposes sanctions on Iranian oil exports.
Drone and missile attacks on Saudi oil facilities temporarily remove significant production capacity.

event_name: COVID-19 demand shock and price war
description: Global demand collapse from COVID-19 and Saudi-Russia price war cause extreme volatility in Brent prices.
Oil markets experience severe stress with historic price collapses in global crude benchmarks.
OPEC and allies agree to record production cuts to stabilize collapsing oil prices.
Rising global demand and limited supply lead to strong recovery in Brent oil prices.
Russian invasion of Ukraine triggers fears of supply disruptions and sanctions on Russian oil exports.

event_name: Peak oil prices during early war period
description: Brent crude prices spike above 130 USD per barrel amid heightened geopolitical risk and uncertainty.
Political unrest across the Middle East and North Africa increases supply risk and price volatility.
European Union implements oil embargo against Iran, tightening global supply conditions.
Implementation of JCPOA eases sanctions on Iranian oil exports, adding supply to the market.
Brent crude reaches record highs before the global financial crisis reduces demand.
Global financial crisis intensifies, triggering a sharp drop in oil demand and prices.
